intro: Thalictrum javanicum var. puberulum, commonly known as the hairy meadow-rue, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves and clusters of small, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream sides. It has a slender, herbaceous stem that often lies prostrate or forms low mats. Its unique morphology and habitat preferences make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
